IssueTriggerStrategy.description: The strategy uses to open the issue

connections.description: A pattern to match on the connection name or array of connection IDs. Use `*` as wildcard.

TransformationExecutionLogLevel.description: The minimum log level to open the issue on

transformations.description: A pattern to match on the transformation name or array of transformation IDs. Use `*` as wildcard.

IssueTriggerBackpressureDelay.description: The minimum delay (backpressure) to open the issue for min of 1 minute (60000) and max of 1 day (86400000)

destinations.description: A pattern to match on the destination name or array of destination IDs. Use `*` as wildcard.

responded_at.description: Date the destination responded to this attempt

tags.name: Issue Triggers
tags.description: Issue Triggers lets you setup rules that trigger issues when certain conditions are met.

tags.name: Attempts
tags.description: An attempt is any request that Hookdeck makes on behalf of an event.

tags.name: Bookmarks
tags.description: A bookmark lets you conveniently store and replay a specific request.

tags.name: Destinations
tags.description: A destination is any endpoint to which your webhooks can be routed.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: An event is any request that Hookdeck receives from a source.

tags.name: Integrations
tags.description: An integration configures platform-specific behaviors, such as signature verification.

tags.name: Issues
tags.description: Issues lets you track problems in your workspace and communicate resolution steps with your team.

tags.name: Requests
tags.description: A request represent a webhook received by Hookdeck.

tags.name: Rulesets
tags.description: A ruleset defines a group of rules that can be used across many connections.

tags.name: Sources
tags.description: A source represents any third party that sends webhooks to Hookdeck.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: Notifications let your team receive alerts anytime an issue changes.

tags.name: Transformations
tags.description: A transformation represents JavaScript code that will be executed on a connection's requests. Transformations are applied to connections using Rules.

tags.name: Connections
tags.description: A connection lets you route webhooks from a source to a destination, using a ruleset.
